Federica_intro.narrator:
The churchyard reeks of fresh-turned earth. Between the headstones, 
			two figures work by lantern-light — a broad-shouldered half-orc woman and
			 a slack-jawed man driving his shovel with mechanical patience. Neither has seen you yet.
Federica_intro.Surgeon-Captain Federica: Deeper, Verhoeven.  No martyr of the antique world lies in a coffin this shallow.
Federica_intro.Verhoeven: 'Outstanding, Ma'am!'  **He rolls the casket they've uneartherd on its side and tirelessly resumes his digging beneath its resting place**

choices.text: What Ho, Graverobbers? Speak quickly the reason I should not cry for the guard.
**Pass by quietly, hoping the plunderers don't see you witnessing their crime.**

Federica-intro-talk-down.Surgeon-Captain Federica: Two foreign strangers desecrating graves — in war time no less. I'd expect a speedy trial and an expeditious execution.
**You spot a weapon of unusual shape hanging from her belt, which her hand begins to drift to.** That is, if there are any witnesses to testify.

choices.text: **Back away quietly with your hands raised**.

Federica-intro-agree-to-help:
NARRATOR: The first coffin yields a woman in corroded plate armor — a knight-commander, by the heraldry. Federica kneels beside the remains, produces a leather case of surgical instruments, and inserts three long needles into precise points along the skull.
FEDERICA: Stand back.
NARRATOR: The corpse convulses. A sound comes from it — not speech, not yet. A wet, whistling shriek through a throat half-collapsed with rot.
THE KNIGHT: (thrashing, clawing at her own ruined face) — it BURNS — what have you — I was SLEEPING —
FEDERICA: You served under General Maratesta. You campaigned against Emperor Regalus in the Year of Broken Standards.
THE KNIGHT: (weeping without tears, without eyes) I can feel my bones — they're wrong — everything is WRONG —
FEDERICA: His weaknesses. His habits in battle. Speak and I will let you sleep again.
THE KNIGHT: He... he never took the field himself. Always proxies. We never saw him bleed. Not once. We thought it cowardice — we were fools — please, PLEASE —
NARRATOR: Federica withdraws the needles. The corpse drops like a puppet cut from its strings. She records something in a small notebook, expression unchanged.
FEDERICA: Verhoeven. The next one.
VERHOEVEN: Outstanding, Ma'am.

NARRATOR: The second coffin holds a robed man — a court astrologer, judging by the celestial charts crumbling against his chest. The needles go in. He wakes screaming.
THE ASTROLOGER: MY HANDS — I can't feel my — no, I CAN feel them, I can feel them ROTTING —
FEDERICA: You served in the court of Regalus. You were executed for treason. Why?
THE ASTROLOGER: (shuddering, jaw clicking loose and resetting with each word) I cast his — his true horoscope. Not the man's. The thing beneath the man. The stars don't lie — they said his birth was — thousands of years before the — oh gods, my teeth are falling into my stomach —
FEDERICA: What did you learn?
THE ASTROLOGER: Fire. He IS fire. But old fire — banked coals — he's been burning so long he's mostly ash — find the ash — find where he keeps —
NARRATOR: His jaw detaches fully. Federica catches it, examines it briefly, then sets it aside and withdraws the needles. She makes another note.
FEDERICA: Promising. Verhoeven — the deep one now.

NARRATOR: The third coffin is older than the others — black oak, iron-banded, buried deep. Verhoeven's shovel cracks the lid and something inside cracks back.
VERHOEVEN: ...Ma'am?
NARRATOR: The lid explodes upward. A corpse sits bolt upright in the ruined casket — desiccated, eyeless, wearing the rotted vestments of a Scarlattian senator dead three centuries. Its jaw unhinges with a sound like tearing leather.
THE SENATOR: He still sits the throne. He still wears the face. You dig for answers in the graves of those he's already silenced — do you think we failed for lack of TRYING?
NARRATOR: It scrambles from the hole with horrible, insectile speed and vanishes over the churchyard wall into darkness.
Silence. Then — torchlight, and the clatter of armor from the lane.
GUARD-SERGEANT: Halt! Stand where you are — all of you!
NARRATOR: Four city guards pour through the churchyard gate, halberds leveled. They see the open graves, the scattered bones, the three of you caked in dirt.
Centurion: Graverobbers and a gods-damned necromancer. On your knees, the lot of you.
FEDERICA: (quietly, to you) I will not kneel. That is not negotiable. What you do next — that is your affair.
VERHOEVEN: (setting down his shovel with great care, as though placing a child in a crib) Outstanding, Ma'am.

Federica-intro-let-go.Surgeon Captain Federica: **The scowl on her face suggests she thinks your cowardice genuine, and it disgusts her.  She does not pursue you, but picks up her shovel with renewed urgency.**

choices.text: I'm just a traveler passing through.
My name is [[game.protagonist.name]], on official business for the Jarl.

guard_traveler.guard: Is that so? We've had trouble with *travelers* lately.
Move along, but I'm watching you.

guard_persuade_success.guard: The Jarl? Ah, I see the **Jarl's sigil** on your cloak.
Very well, [[game.protagonist.name]]. Go on in. Don't cause any trouble.

guard_persuade_failure.guard: The Jarl? Hmm... you don't look like his usual company.

end_convo.narrator: The guard nods and you walk away.

end_convo_pass.narrator: The guard steps aside and lets you pass through the gate.

I have *rare goods* from across the realm, [[protagonist.name]]!

merchant_weapons.merchant: Ah, a warrior! I have some *fine blades* here.
Each one has tasted **victory** in battle!

merchant_potions.merchant: Indeed! Healing draughts, mana elixirs, even some exotic brews.

merchant_browse.merchant: Of course, of course! Take your time.
Let me know if anything interests you.

merchant_end.narrator: The merchant waves as you depart.
